other_tests.findings: Uterine cavity had normal volume, symmetric contours, and no mucosal irregularity or filling defects. Distal ampullary and infundibular portions were abnormally dilated with multiple filling defects. Lack of free spillage of contrast material indicated bilateral tubal occlusion.
Weakly proliferative endometrium with multiple compact, nonnecrotizing granulomas. No polarizing material was present and no evidence of organisms.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A second biopsy taken 1 month later revealed one well-formed nonnecrotizing granuloma, without necrosis.

other_tests.findings: Culture and staining were negative for M. tuberculosis.

other_tests.date: Approximately 1 month after the first biopsy
other_tests.findings: Initial examination showed proliferative endometrium; deeper levels revealed a single, well-formed nonnecrotizing granuloma. Acid-fast staining was negative for bacteria.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Cultures confirmed positive for M. tuberculosis complex subsequently.
